comment_101:
eminem is living proof that you do not need special effects and "hoes" and "sluts" and lyrics about the "hood and being gangsta" in order to make a good song and video to go with it.

to nirvana rules. 

shut up. get over the beatles. its over. move on with your life. quit living in the past. and what makes you think he exploits his daughter??? he does whatever he can to protect her. he doesnt go around like other celebrities like "HEY HERES MY KID LOOK!!!" if you didnt notice, hailie is about 9 years old now. look at her in the video. those are obviously all years old. laney is about 12 now and i know because shes three years younger than me she. she turns twelve sometime this month. and look at her in the video.  what was the oldest you saw laney in the video like seven eight years old??? exactly those are OLD as hell. did you NOT see how her face was blurred out? obviously he doesnt want people knowing what his daughter currently looks like. thats what hes BEEN doing. thats why he thought it was okay to put those old home vids out now. he didnt want people knowing what she currently looks like. had he been so called "exploiting" hailie, he would have released mocking bird 4 years ago when she was 5 and laney was 8.  she must look different now or else marshall would have NEVER put her old stuff in the video. do YOU look the same way you did when you were 5 and 8 years old?? i hope you dont. cuz there have been leaked pictures of laney and  hailie on the internet and let me tell you they do look older. 
her most recent pictures havent been released  purposely by eminem. so how is he exploiting his daughter?? people always see eminem as this evil monster. hes trying to show that hes a dad and that hes always going to be by her side. does that eminem in the real slim shady video look like the same DADDY in mockingbird?? no  he doesnt.eminem has always said that hes always daddy before hes eminem. so if rap makes you cringe so much, you might want to crawl in a hole cuz rap is going to be around for a long time to come. there are worse cases of exploitation by celebrities. of their own kids. i saw one thing on the "fabulous life of celebrity children" and some parents actually let people take pictures of their kids (basically invade their childrens privacy) for MONEY!!! how sick is that. they actually ALLOW people to take snapshots of their kids for money. so dont come on here and bitch about eminem "exploiting" his kid. he doesnt. he does whatever he can to protect her privacy. if you want exploitation, see madonna, angelina jolie, and all those other fuckers.  and by the way..... how many videos has hailie appeared in besides this one????

comment_104:
all of you saying the ending kinda ruins it with the killing of the mockingbird, and the carat eating... kinda don't get it...

The reason I see to put something like that, is to show EXACTLY what you would do for your child... if you wouldn't 'kill' in the illiteral sense for your child, you deserve not to have one... hell, I would beat some guys ass who messed with my little sister because I love her so much... wait till i get a daughter, it's gonna be hell until she turns 18 and moves out... ;)

oh, and the part about christmas I just broke down... literally, that hit me like a ton of bricks, because something similiar happened last christmas... just didn't have the money, so my gf put my name on a few presents and said they were from me...

I have no children btw, because I am poor and cannot afford them, so most of em's songs about his daughter's really hits me, because I would love to raise and care for a child, but I don't want to bring them into a world where they won't be able to get what they need...  THAT is what this song says to me... the part about the money jar for college... 
"Shh, momma's only gone for the moment"
and mostly this part...
"But then of course everything always happens for a reason
I guess it was never meant to be
But it's just something we have no control over and that's what destiny is
But no more worries, rest your head and go to sleep
Maybe one day we'll wake up and this will all just be a dream"

along with good die young by d12 and I ain't mad atcha\dear mama by tupac this song is standing pretty on the podium for my favorite hip-hop song

comment_154:
i fucking cried my eyes out listening to this song.
i can really relate to this.
when i listen to this, i think back to when my daddy loved me. 
He always told me that he would do anything for me, but i guess he lied.
The part of the chorus when it says "I know mommy's not here right now and we don't know why", I can really relate to this. 
Because even though my mom is here physically, she's not mentally.
I can honestly say that my parents dont really give a flying fuck about their only kid.
I know that most of the people who read this will reply to this saying something like "We don't care about your problems" but incase you haven't noticed, the comment box says "What does this song mean to you" and this song happens to mean something to me.
So fuck off.
comment_155: it about his daughter and how he trying to make up for missing out a lot in her life when she was a child.
comment_156: even though i hate rap i absolutely love this song and i can really relate to it. even though my dad was very abusive towards my mom and when they divorced i rarely saw him i always knew i was his princess and i knew that as long as daddy was alive nothing was gonna harm me. i know what its like to live in a neighborhood where every other house is getting robbed and i really admire Eminem for getting himself and his daughter out of that situation but still being able to admit he has problems and being willing to work on them (like my dad) perhaps what i love most about Eminem though is how seemingly effortless he can tell the story of millions of people and how easy it is to relate

comment_159:
To the people that feel like the last part ruined the song...I personally liked it because through the whole song you have the other side of Eminem and he throws a little of his other side on the last part. Basically saying that he'd do anything and everything for his girls.

For me, this song is meant to explain to his daughter and his niece about what is currently going on in their lives and with their mother Kim and Eminem's relationship and reassuring the both of them that he will always be there for the both of them and he'll never leave them under any circumstances.

He knows that his daughter is sad that her mother isn't there and Eminem is just trying to comfort her.
